wolw that's a sad schoo: does linux comes with a default firewall?
it comes with a tool to set up firewall rules (iptables)
its true, win XP can boot with 64mb ram
iptables is command line only, but there are many frontends (like firestarter) to make it easier
you can install it by typing: sudo apt-get install firestarter. however i prefer setting up the rules with iptables itself, in a shell script.
did you install with the package manager?
that should be removable. but i dont use this graphical stuff install/deinstall.
i like using apt-get on the command line
you can look up the package name of the java plugin by: dpkg -l | grep plugin
i am not god of ubuntu :))
now you do: sudo apt-get remove --purge name_of_the_plugin_package
you may have to close the add/remove window before that
apt-get will inform you if it has to remove additional packages depending on the plugin package
